intro: Echium balearicum, commonly known as the Balearic fleur-de-lis, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its striking, violet-blue flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family, which is known for its hairy stems and showy flowers. Echium balearicum is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
